Larangan Pencalonan Koruptor di Pilkada 2020 Dibahas Lagi di DPR
04 Nov 2019, 23:20 by Antara, Purwanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta -Komisi II Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Republik Indonesia (DPR RI) belum mencapai kesepakatan soal narapidana (napi) koruptor dilarang mencalonkan diri menjadi kepala daerah dalam rancangan revisi Peraturan Komisi Pemilihan Umum nomor 3 tahun 2017.
Hal itu disampaikan Ketua Komisi II DPR RI, Ahmad Doli Kurnia usai menggelar rapat dengar pendapat bersama Komisi Pemilihan Umum, Badan Pengawas Pemilu, dan Kementerian Dalam Negeri.
"Kami belum bisa mengambil kesepahaman bersama sehingga kami perlu melanjutkan lagi di (rapat) hari berikutnya," ujar politisi Golkar itu di Jakarta, Senin.
Dalam rancangan perubahan PKPU Nomor 3/2017, aturan mengenai pelarangan mantan terpidana kasus korupsi maju dipilkada ada dalam Pasal 4 huruf h.
Doli mengatakan peraturan mengenai terpidana tindak pidana korupsi dilarang mencalonkan diri dalam Undang-Undang sudah pernah dibatalkan melalui uji materi di Mahkamah Konstitusi.
Selain itu, Mahkamah Agung membatalkan aturan PKPU terkait pelarangan eks narapidana koruptor menjadi Calon Legislatif.
Sementara, Komisi Pemilihan Umum tetap ingin memasukkan kembali aturan pelarangan narapidana koruptor mencalonkan diri dalam Pemilihan Kepala Daerah.
Hal itu karena dua alasan, seperti yang dikatakan Ketua KPU, Arief Budiman. Pertama, KPU khawatir terpidana korupsi tidak bisa menjalankan amanat karena mesti menjalani proses peradilan.
Arief mengatakan boleh saja orang bilang untuk menyerahkan saja kepada pemilih. Toh, pemilih nanti akan memilih yang terbaik.
Tapi faktanya, kata Arief, ada calon kepala daerah yang sudah ditangkap, ditahan, dan dia tidak akan bisa menggunakan hak pilih tapi dia menang Pemilu.
Akhirnya, orang tersebut tidak bisa memimpin karena dirinya harus menjalani proses peradilan. Sehingga ditunjuk orang lain yang memimpin daerah tersebut.
"Itu fakta. Menyerahkan kepada masyarakat (akibatnya) seperti itu," ujar Arief.
Alasan kedua mengapa KPU 'ngotot' ingin agar terpidana korupsi tidak ikut mencalonkan diri dalam Pemilihan Kepala Daerah adalah karena KPU tidak ingin terpidana yang melakukan tindak pidana korupsi, terpilih lagi menjadi kepala daerah sehingga ia melakukan tindak pidana korupsi lagi.
Komisi II DPR RI belum bisa mengambil kesimpulan dan akan melaksanakan rapat dengar pendapat berikutnya pada Senin pekan depan.
Mereka juga akan mengundang Direktorat Jenderal Kependudukan dan Catatan Sipil (Ditjen Dukcapil) untuk duduk bersama membahas evaluasi pemilu serentak 2019.
Ketua Komisi II DPR RI, Ahmad Doli Kurnia merasa perlu ada evaluasi dan penyempurnaan menyeluruh peraturan untuk pemilihan Kepala Daerah, Pemilihan Legislatif, maupun Pemilihan Presiden dan Wakil Presiden. Namun, kemungkinan penyempurnaan itu dilakukan setelah Pilkada Serentak 2020.
"Kita lihat perkembangannya nanti seperti apa. Mana (kekurangan) yang bisa ditutupi melalui PKPU, mana yang perlu revisi (Undang-Undang)," ujar Doli.
Ia mengatakan masa sidang tahun ini tinggal tanggal 12 Desember 2019. Kemudian masa sidang tahun depan akan masuk di tanggal 6 Januari 2020. Sementara tahapan pemilu harus sudah dimulai pendaftaran calon bulan Juni 2020.
"Kira-kira mungkin tidak (revisi Undang-Undang) itu terjadi? Makanya, harus kami atur betul situasinya untuk melihat materi revisi (Undang-Undang), memungkinkan tidak untuk kami melakukan revisi," kata Doli.
Ia mengatakan sementara ini belum bisa melihat akan ada revisi Undang-Undang Nomor 10 tahun 2016 tentang Pemilihan Kepala Daerah yang sudah ada di depan mata dan Undang-Undang Nomor 7 tahun 2017 tentang Pemilihan Umum.
"Nanti kami mendahului ya, makanya sementara ini kita pakai saja dasar Undang-Undang yang berlaku itu," ujar Doli.

Prohibition of Corruption Candidate Nominations in 2020 Election Is Discussed Again in the DPR
04 Nov 2019, 23:20 by Antara, Purwanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Commission II of the House of Representatives of the Republic of Indonesia (DPR RI) has not yet reached an agreement regarding corrupt prisoners (prisoners) being prohibited from running for regional head in the draft revision of Election Commission Regulation number 3 of 2017.
This was conveyed by Chairman of the House of Representatives Commission II, Ahmad Doli Kurnia after holding a hearing with the General Election Commission, the Election Supervisory Body, and the Ministry of the Interior.
"We have not been able to take a shared understanding so we need to continue in the next (meeting) day," the Golkar politician said in Jakarta on Monday.
In the draft amendment to PKPU No. 3/2017, rules regarding the banning of ex-convicted advanced corruption cases in the regional election are in Article 4 letter h.
Doli said the regulation regarding convicted of corruption was prohibited from running in the Act had been canceled through a judicial review in the Constitutional Court.
In addition, the Supreme Court overturned the PKPU rules related to the prohibition of corrupt convicts from becoming Legislative Candidates.
Meanwhile, the General Election Commission still wants to re-enter the rules prohibiting corrupt prisoners from running for Regional Head Election.
That is for two reasons, as stated by the Head of KPU, Arief Budiman. First, the KPU is worried that convicted of corruption cannot carry out the mandate because it must undergo a judicial process.
Arief said that it was okay for people to say to give it to voters. After all, voters will choose the best.
But the fact is, said Arief, there are candidates for regional heads who have been arrested, detained, and he will not be able to use the right to vote but he wins the election.
Finally, the person cannot lead because he has to undergo a judicial process. So that someone else is appointed to lead the area.
"That's a fact. Leave it to the people (as a result) like that," Arief said.
The second reason why the KPU 'insisted' that the convicted of corruption not participate in the Regional Head Election was because the KPU did not want the convicted person to commit a criminal act of corruption, being re-elected as the regional head so that he would commit a criminal act of corruption again.
Commission II of the Indonesian House of Representatives has not been able to draw conclusions and will hold its next hearing on Monday next week.
They will also invite the Directorate General of Population and Civil Registry (Ditjen Dukcapil) to sit together to discuss the evaluation of the 2019 concurrent elections.
Chairman of the House of Representatives Commission II, Ahmad Doli Kurnia felt there was a need for a comprehensive evaluation and improvement of regulations for the election of Regional Heads, Legislative Elections, as well as the Election of President and Vice President. However, the possibility of improvement was carried out after the 2020 Simultaneous Local Election.
"We will see what the development will be like. Which (lack) can be covered through PKPU, which needs to be revised (Law)," said Doli.
He said that the trial period for this year will be on December 12, 2019. Then next year's trial period will be on January 6, 2020. While the election stage must have begun registration of candidates for June 2020.
"I wonder if it might not have happened (the revision of the Act)? Therefore, we have to adjust the situation properly to see the revised material (Law), allowing us not to revise," said Doli.
He said that while he could not yet see there would be a revision of Law Number 10 of 2016 concerning the Election of Regional Heads that had already been in sight and Law Number 7 of 2017 concerning General Elections.
"Later we will overtake it, so for the time being we will use the basis of the applicable law," said Doli.
